Articles.Content:
Hey, all. This is senselessly naive but I thought it be fun to get into modding and I was curious about the best way to get started? What key software should I check out for modeling and textures and such? Do people have strong preferences about 3ds vs Maya? I have a fair bit of experience 3d modeling for architecture but Im sure it will be a huge transition making assets. Just thinking of getting my feet wet. 

Edited May 18, 2021 by Pthigrivi

I think most people are using Blender and there are some tools for Blender that can write a .mu file directly:

It is possible to use other tools but, as far as I know, you'll need to run them through Unity (a free download) to generate the .mu file. The current version of Unity is 2019.2.2f1 - you could use another version but would probably want to find the PartTools

that goes with the Unity version your using (have not tried to mix PartTools and Unity versions myself).

If you do go with the non-Blender 3D software you'll want to make sure it can export a format that Unity understands - I've used .dae and .fbx - don't know what other formats it accepts.

And the short answer is: you'll need a 3d modeling program, Unity and Parttools.
